author: SmallCapLS
content: A new gig prevents me from commenting on specific stocks but here are ten random lessons I learned/reminders I received from mkts in '14:

author: SmallCapLS
content: (1) bull mkts create bull mkts in relative valuation investing, where asset quality can become a secondary detail to industry SIC code

author: SmallCapLS
content: (2) Biz have hidden exposure to many things(fx, end mkts) - these variables are so impactful when important precisely bc they are so ignored

author: SmallCapLS
content: (3) basic investing playbooks (buy the spin!) increasingly fail to work when herd behavior creates feedback loop into starting point...

author: SmallCapLS
content: (3 cont'd) ....valuations and corporate decisions (ie spinning off complete crap)

author: SmallCapLS
content: (4) allocators can create traffic jams: floods of capital into sector-specific funds (TMT) nets ST outperformance but indigestion thereafter

author: SmallCapLS
content: (5) when core/entrenched mkt paradigms shift (ie oil prices), being late to the equity/credit wreckage is far preferable to being early

author: SmallCapLS
content: (6) the pt at which investors embrace/re-rate tax structures is the pt at which the assets employing these structures test mkt's generosity

author: SmallCapLS
content: (7) an investment thesis that begins and ends with "buybacks" in an industry that is structurally changing is not a thesis

author: SmallCapLS
content: (8) activists are often more about choosing targets that protect/promote their franchise than those w/real room for impact...follower beware

author: SmallCapLS
content: (9) corporate boards are not unlike investors -- their behavior gets shaped largely by actions of peers -- and so sector m&a can cascade

author: SmallCapLS
content: (10) Mkts fear containable (ie non-airborne) diseases far more than they fear potentially uncontainable govts that are threatened w/collapse

author: SmallCapLS
content: Some lessons learned and re-learned in '15 that I figured I'd share as the calendar turns...

author: SmallCapLS
content: Return on one's time is as important as return on an investment; some of best stocks can be suboptimal investments bc of time they consume

author: SmallCapLS
content: Multiple a biz is afforded is a direct derivative of mgmt credibility; even w/ biz that can "run itself" to own is to invite unforced error

author: SmallCapLS
content: Later stages of any bull mkt are increasingly flow & positioning driven; coherent view on who incremental buyer of any security is is a must

author: SmallCapLS
content: Catalyst-driven investing works well for stocks w/natural shareholder base but poor return on volatility when catalyst is only reason to own

author: SmallCapLS
content: Ignoring macro drivers no better than ignoring basic industry competitive dynamics..in fact worse bc mgmt at least has clue about the latter

author: SmallCapLS
content: Mgmt perpetually overconfident in ability to pass on cost inflation; career/comp risk for sales teams typically pulls in opposite direction

author: SmallCapLS
content: Thematic investing is particularly in tune with bull mkts but is playground of least informed shareholders…expect extreme vol as mkt turns

author: SmallCapLS
content: It always pays to be the person IR is sick of hearing from; the more frequent the conversations, the easier to appraise changes in tone

author: SmallCapLS
content: Looking at companies at enterprise/not equity level is perpetual source of edge, but never more so than when credit cycle begins to sputter

author: SmallCapLS
content: And with that, good luck to all in the year ahead.

author: SmallCapLS
content: My favorite fact of this depressing election will be that Trump ran a cash bar at his victory party.

author: SmallCapLS
content: The past 2 years around this time, I’ve tweeted out some “lessons learned and re-learned” from the year just ended; thought I’d do it again:

author: SmallCapLS
content: 1/A strong view on a binary outcome is not an excuse to ignore how risk premium associated with the alternative outcome may get priced in

author: SmallCapLS
content: 2/Sector ‘bubbles’ once popped don’t repair overnight; beware the false promise of upside that is based on where a stock recently traded

author: SmallCapLS
content: 3/High relative valuation represents scarcity of “something” - yield, growth, en vogue exposure - if scarcity erodes, so too will multiple

author: SmallCapLS
content: 4/Differentiation always monetizes best when in the future tense; it is very hard to get paid on a differentiated view of present conditions

author: SmallCapLS
content: 5/Positioning - not fundamentals - matters most as a boundary condition at market extremes

author: SmallCapLS
content: 6/Tops in cyclicals are made when claims of structural growth emerge, bottoms in structural growers ar made when fears of cyclicality emerge

author: SmallCapLS
content: 7/A material catalyst unrewarded with expected price action is as close to a clear GTFO signal as the market gods will ever give

author: SmallCapLS
content: 8/The explosion of platform shop AUM - and the groupthink/crowds therein -  has increased both rewards and asymmetry of contrarian positions

author: SmallCapLS
content: 9/Corps are led by individuals w/their own incentives – monetary or otherwise – that will always trump your logic of what mgmt *should* do

author: SmallCapLS
content: And with that, good luck to all in the year ahead

author: SmallCapLS
content: 1/I dont think this is accurate; IMO it is a function of predominantly L/S equity PMs viewing yearend px action and… https://t.co/nE1ykaY6Hk

author: SmallCapLS
content: 2/While year-end equity px action was to a certain degree as befuddling/thin as described, this week -as much as mkt ever can-‘”made sense”

author: SmallCapLS
content: 3/Unexpected policy/other moves by the Chinese caused CNH price action that went against massively one-sided macro fund positioning

author: SmallCapLS
content: 4/The violence of that move also rippled through macro fund risk models, compounding loss-driven de-risking in other popular macro trades

author: SmallCapLS
content: 5/And so JPY, KRW, EUR et al reversed initial ’17 pop violently and rates ripped in, with each move in one feeding the fury elsewhere

author: SmallCapLS
content: 6/And guess what equity sectors those same macro funds were severely long? Financials, Steels, Energy – and so pain there as well…

author: SmallCapLS
content: 7/...hitting L/S platform shop industrials books (most long steels/energy, short those same pricey industrials) +others similarly positioned

author: SmallCapLS
content: 8/At same time, some (less prevalent than the long positioning) of those macro funds + many generalist funds have been tilting short FANG...

author: SmallCapLS
content: 9/And so domino-ing weak-hand covering came just as TMT funds had (finally) passed some brutal year-end redemption-driven selling

author: SmallCapLS
content: 10/So voila! Crowded macro+Trump equity sector trades selloff, industrials squeeze, TMT rallies...but a major fundamental event was trigger

author: SmallCapLS
content: 11/This is a gross oversimplification, but FWIW it is how I see it. Head scratcher was strength of Chinese action. Positioning did the rest

author: SmallCapLS
